result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Kuhnert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/schooling or combination thereof.  If not, must perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

SAFE program.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not then perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed. No contact with C.A. unless approved by agent.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
AODA w/ follow up.
SAFE assessment and comply with recommendations.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:12 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF494, 16TR2316, AND 14CF1097. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Genelle Johnson. 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF494. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 4 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 3 (DC/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 16CF494 AND SENTENCING AFTER REV IN 14CF1097. 
VRCW. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF1097: Ct. 1>>33 months imprisonment - 21 months IC and 12 months ES - with 271 days sentence credit. 
                      : Ct. 2>>33 months imprisonment - 21 months IC and 12 months ES - with 271 days sentence credit.  
In 16CF494: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - with 77 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 3>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - with 77 days sentence credit. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES on all: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through; SAFE asssessment and comply with any recommendations; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed; no contact with C.A. unless approved by agent; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 2 DA surcharges in 16CF494 and unpaid costs from 14CF1097. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands def to custody for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 3:35 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sent to Judge
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Genelle Johnson
